org.wildfly.security.auth.server

Interface RealmIdentity

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ModifiableRealmIdentity

    public interface RealmIdentity
    A representation of a pre-authentication identity. The life of a RealmIdentity is short and is for a specific authentication attempt. A SecurityRealm creating a RealmIdentity does not confirm the existence of the identity.
    Author:
    Darran Lofthouse

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static RealmIdentity ANONYMOUS
      The anonymous realm identity.
      static RealmIdentity NON_EXISTENT
      An identity for a non-existent user.

    • Method Detail

      • getCredentialAcquireSupport

        SupportLevel getCredentialAcquireSupport(String credentialName)
                                  throws RealmUnavailableException
        Determine whether a given credential is definitely obtainable, possibly obtainable, or definitely not obtainable for this identity.
        Parameters:
        credentialName - the name of the credential
        Returns:
        the level of support for this credential type
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason

      • getCredential

        Credential getCredential(String credentialName)
                  throws RealmUnavailableException
        Acquire a credential of the given name.
        Parameters:
        credentialName - the name of the credential
        Returns:
        the credential, or null if the principal has no credential of that name
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason

      • getCredential

        default <C extends Credential> C getCredential(String credentialName,
                                               Class<C> credentialType)
                                        throws RealmUnavailableException
        Acquire a credential of the given name, cast to the given type.
        Type Parameters:
        C - the type to which should be credential casted
        Parameters:
        credentialName - the name of the credential
        credentialType - the class of type to which should be credential casted
        Returns:
        the credential, or null if the principal has no credential of that name or cannot be casted to that type
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason

      • getCredential

        default <C extends Credential> C getCredential(String credentialName,
                                               Class<C> credentialType,
                                               Set<String> supportedAlgorithms)
                                        throws RealmUnavailableException
        Acquire a credential of the given name, if the Credential instance also implements AlgorithmCredential verify that the algorithm is also in the list of supported algorithms, then cast to the given type.
        Type Parameters:
        C - the type to which should be credential casted
        Parameters:
        credentialName - the name of the credential
        supportedAlgorithms - the Set of algorithm names with which the algorithm of the credential must match if it has one.
        Returns:
        the credential, or null if the principal has no credential of that name, or the algorithm of the available credential was not available, or cannot be casted to that type
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason

      • getCredential

        default Credential getCredential(List<String> credentialNames,
                                 Map<Class<? extends Credential>,Set<String>> supportedTypesWithAlgorithms)
                          throws RealmUnavailableException
        Acquire a credential after resolving a List of possible credential names against a Map of supported credential types against Sets of supported algorithms for each of those types.
        Parameters:
        credentialNames - the list of credential names to attempt to load and cross reference against the Map of supported credentials along with their supported algorithms
        supportedTypesWithAlgorithms - the mapping of supported credential types associated with a set of supported algorithms for each of those types.
        Returns:
        the credential resolved by the realm
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason

      • getEvidenceVerifySupport

        default SupportLevel getEvidenceVerifySupport(String credentialName)
                                       throws RealmUnavailableException
        Determine whether a given piece of evidence is definitely verifiable, possibly verifiable, or definitely not verifiable for this identity.
        Parameters:
        credentialName - the name of the credential that the evidence is to be verified against
        Returns:
        the level of support for this credential type
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason

      • verifyEvidence

        default boolean verifyEvidence(String credentialName,
                               Evidence evidence)
                        throws RealmUnavailableException
        Verify the given credential.
        Parameters:
        evidence - the evidence to verify
        Returns:
        true if verification was successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason

      • exists

        boolean exists()
        throws RealmUnavailableException
        Determine if the identity exists in lieu of verifying or acquiring a credential. This method is intended to be used to verify an identity for non-authentication purposes only.
        Returns:
        true if the identity exists in this realm, false otherwise
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason

      • dispose

        default void dispose()
        Dispose this realm identity after a completed authentication attempt.

      • getAuthorizationIdentity

        default AuthorizationIdentity getAuthorizationIdentity()
                                                throws RealmUnavailableException
        Get an authorization identity for this pre-authenticated identity.
        Returns:
        the authorization identity (may not be null)
        Throws:
        RealmUnavailableException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason
